performance_progress:
Alex is a verbally strong, engaged student who participates well in class discussions when prompted.
He demonstrates solid conceptual understanding but reads below grade level and tires quickly with dense text.
He benefits from structured routines, chunked tasks, and visual supports.

education_goals.academic:
By June 2026, Alex will improve comprehension of grade 9 texts with support, demonstrating at least 80% on
teacher-created comprehension tasks when provided with text-to-speech and guided questions.
education_goals.social: Alex will appropriately ask for help or clarification when confused in 4 out of 5 observed opportunities.
education_goals.behavioural:
Alex will begin assigned tasks within 3 minutes and remain on task for 15â€“20 minutes with no more than one prompt
in 4 out of 5 observed classes.
education_goals.communicative:
Alex will clearly explain his thinking using sentence starters or visual organizers during class discussions and
small group work.
education_goals.physical: No significant physical or mobility needs at this time.

accommodations.instructional:
Provide step-by-step instructions.
Pre-teach key vocabulary with visuals.
Allow Alex to respond orally or with bullet points for longer written tasks.
accommodations.environmental:
Preferential seating away from high-traffic areas.
Access to a quiet space or hallway for tests as needed.
accommodations.assessment:
1.5x time on tests and in-class quizzes.
Allow use of word processor and spell-check.
Reduce copying from the board.
accommodations.technology:
Access to laptop for writing tasks.
Use of text-to-speech for readings.
Use of speech-to-text for longer written responses.

assessments:
Psychoeducational assessment (May 2024) indicates average cognitive ability with significant weaknesses in basic
reading and written expression. School data shows improved performance when technology, guided notes, and
additional time are provided.
transition_goals:
Short-term: build independence using assistive technology and requesting accommodations.
Long-term: prepare Alex for senior courses and post-secondary options that match his interests in technology and design.
